alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 4:08PM CST until further notice by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Fayette. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Grange, Schulenburg, Flatonia, Fayetteville, Round Top, Muldoon, Ammannsville, Mullins Prairie, Swiss Alp, Holman, O`Quinn, Rabbs Prairie, Dubina, Freyburg, Rutersville, High Hill, Ellinger, Engle, Walhalla and Warrenton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
